p: The MICs defined as the deepest concentrations of the EO that allows for full progress inhibition of R. stolonifer, V. dahliae, C. gloeosporioides, B. cinerea, and A. niger were 1.6, 3.1, 3.4, 3.6, and 4.7 mg/mL, respectively ( Table 5). R. stolonifer was discovered to be the greatest sensitive fungal pathogens towards the A. millefolium EO.
